Article Title: FDI and Industry Agglomeration in West Area
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: FDI; Industry Agglomeration; West Area; Panel Data
Abstract: After the 1990s, foreign direct investment is increasingly becoming the main way of introducing foreign capital. The research of the relationship between FDI and domestic economy is also becoming more striking. Current researches mainly focus on the site factor of FDI, while they pay little attention on the aspect of the relationship between FDI and industry agglomeration, especially the relationship in the West Area. This paper filters the FDI and industry agglomeration data of the west 11 provinces or municipalities including 14 industries in 2001-2009, and deploys theoretical and empirical analysis method and explores the interaction between FDI and industry agglomeration in the west area both in the horizontal and vertical angles. First, we introduce literature review and current domestic researches concerning FDI and industry agglomeration. In addition, basing the theoretical analysis, we choose some indicators representing industry agglomeration and build up an accounting econometric model combining these indicators with FDI. Our empirical analysis shows it exists long-term stable relationship as well as short-term significant positive correlation between the two one. At the end, we provide our suggestion of how to promote the benign interaction between FDI and industry agglomeration in the west area.

Authors: Lin, YT; Gong, SC; Wu, SS; Lee, TP
Author Full Names: Lin, Yan-Ting; Gong, Shang-Chi; Wu, Sou-Shan; Lee, Tsung-Pei
Article Title: E/P Mean Reversion-Based Strategies for Investment Practice: Evidence from the Taiwan Market
Author Keywords: E/P ratio; investment strategy; mean reversion; time series analysis
Keywords Plus: TECHNICAL TRADING RULES; TIME-SERIES; VALUATION RATIOS; INVESTORS; EARNINGS; PROFITABILITY; RETURNS; WINNERS; STOCKS
Abstract: This study investigates the mean-reversion characteristic in firm-specific earnings-to-price ratios (E/P ratios) and proposes two investment strategies based on the detected mean-reversion feature of E/P ratios. We differentiate our study from other research by analyzing firm-specific time series data. The results show that, of the 1,156 nonfinancial firms listed on the Taiwan Stock Exchange and the GraTai Securities Market in 2006, the E/P ratios of 516 (about 45 percent) exhibited a tendency of mean reversion. Furthermore, we design two investment strategies based on the detected mean-reversion feature of firm-specific E/P ratios and report the dominant investment performances.

Authors: Masrek, MN; Uzir, NA; Khairuddin, II
Author Full Names: Masrek, Mohamad Noorman; Uzir, Nor'ayu Ahmad; Khairuddin, Irni Iliana
Article Title: Examining Trust in Mobile Banking: A Conceptual Framework
Source Title: INNOVATION AND SUSTAINABLE COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE: FROM REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO WORLD ECONOMIES, VOLS 1-5
Conference Title: 18th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Author Keywords: Mobile banking; conceptual model; trust; Malaysia
Keywords Plus: INITIAL TRUST; TECHNOLOGY; ADOPTION; DYNAMICS; SERVICE
Abstract: While the number of retail banks providing mobile banking services has significantly increased, the adoption rate among consumers is still consider very low. One of the critical issues identified by researchers is the aspect of trust. In a mobile banking environment, three categories of trustee which are the retail banks that provide mobile banking services; the mobile telecommunication provider that provide mobile internet services; and the mobile gadget that is used as the medium for engaging in mobile banking transaction are equally important and must be addressed in order to establish trust of the consumer. Against this background, this paper develops a conceptual model of trust which covers the three aforementioned trustees in mobile banking. The model should be of interest to both researcher and practitioner as it will help to identify factors influencing trust building of the mobile banking consumers, hence leading towards increased adoption and utilization.

Article Title: The Relationship between Entrepreneurial Competence and Financing Choices
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: uncertain; entrepreneurial competence; financing choices; resource based view
Keywords Plus: DYNAMIC CAPABILITIES; RADICAL INNOVATION; RESEARCH AGENDA; PERFORMANCE; PERSPECTIVE; ENTERPRISES; MANAGEMENT; BANKS; FIRM
Abstract: In this study we analyze the effect of entrepreneurial competence on financing choices under uncertain environment. Based on RBV we deduct concept and dimensions of entrepreneurial competence. Empirical research has been conducted with a sample of 218 high-tech companies under the environment of technology uncertainty, market uncertainty and organizational uncertainty, and the relationship between entrepreneurial competence and financing choices is consistent with the deduction of real options. The results indicate that opportunity capability is associated with venture capital, whereas the operational capability and the uncertain environment are not conducive to venture capital. Furthermore, operational capability leads to higher negative effect to venture capital when organizational uncertainty increasing, and opportunity capability leads to lower positive effect to venture capital when technology uncertainty increasing.

Authors: Nieminen, E; Lindroos, M; Heikinheimo, O
Author Full Names: Nieminen, Emmi; Lindroos, Marko; Heikinheimo, Outi
Article Title: Optimal Bioeconomic Multispecies Fisheries Management: A Baltic Sea Case Study
Author Keywords: Bioeconomic modeling; fisheries management; multispecies modeling; Baltic Sea; Baltic cod; Baltic herring; sprat; climate change
Keywords Plus: CLIMATE VARIABILITY; COD RECRUITMENT; SPRAT; MODEL; CANNIBALISM; SALINITY; DYNAMICS; IMPACTS; FISH
Abstract: We assess cod, herring, and sprat fisheries in the Baltic Sea under different environmental conditions using a bioeconomic model with simple predation functions. We compare the status quo fishing policy to an optimal policy under two different salinity conditions, which have a link to climate change. The fishery of these species is not at the most profitable level. If the fishing mortalities are lower, economic return will be greater in the long run. A lower fishing mortality for cod, which allows time for individuals to grow and achieve a higher economic value and reproduction potential, would result in the recovery of the cod stock. Under a high salinity level, which leads to better conditions for cod recruitment, the cod stock has a better chance to recover even without a decrease in fishing mortality. Therefore, fishery management is even more important under conditions of low salinity, which are likely to prevail in the future due to changing climate.

Article Title: The Countermeasure Research on Surmounting the Bottlenecks of Employer Brand Construction
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: Enterprise employers brand; Increasing influence; Bottleneck; Countermeasure
Abstract: Enterprise employers brand has been playing more and more important role because of its increasing influence to the recruitment of the talent and even the enterprise's development. However, enterprise employer brand construction is still in the primary stage and it has bottlenecks such as lack of understanding to employer brand, inaccurate localization, and undefined objective. In view of the above reasons, we will analysis the problems to the enterprise employer brand Building in the based of its practical situation, and find the countermeasure to speed up the enterprise employer brand Building and promote the enterprise's competitiveness.

Article Title: Application of Advanced Cost Management Techniques in Hospital Management - Czech Perspective
Source Title: INNOVATION AND SUSTAINABLE COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE: FROM REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO WORLD ECONOMIES, VOLS 1-5
Conference Title: 18th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Author Keywords: Healthcare management; hospital management; cost management; Activity-based costing; costing methods
Abstract: The paper deals with the application of the modern cost management techniques in hospital management. The study analyses the used costing techniques and problems related to the application of accurate costing method in hospitals. It further compares the world approaches and the utilization of sophisticated costing system such as Activity-Based Costing with the situation in the Czech Republic. The study finally delimitates three costing systems: two defined by the Czech National Reference Center - TEZP and TNS and Activity-based approach, which are compared and discussed in great detail.

Article Title: Institutional Communication and the Importance of Paralanguage in Image Management
Source Title: INNOVATION AND SUSTAINABLE COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE: FROM REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO WORLD ECONOMIES, VOLS 1-5
Conference Title: 18th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Author Keywords: institutional communication; paralanguage; behavior; image management
Abstract: In managing an institution's/organization's capital of imagine, the How do I say? question is as important as the What do I say? question. It is about paralanguage importance in particular, and interpersonal communication in general which continues to be (including today) the most efficient method to establish and maintain relationships with our fellows. Thus, first we define institutional communication (aimed at establishing the image of the organization) and provide a concise answer to the What do I say? question aimed at the contents of the sent message. Secondly, we focus on the main idea of this work, the major role of style, paralanguage (with its patterns) in managing the image which let us enter people's inner universe and decode them correctly.

Article Title: Decision Making under Many Quality Criteria
Source Title: CONTRIBUTIONS TO GAME THEORY AND MANAGEMENT, VOL V
Book Series Title: Contributions to Game Theory and Management
Conference Title: 5th International Conference Game Theory and Management
Author Keywords: Multi-criteria decision making; quality criteria; general criterion; direction map
Abstract: We mean a quality criterion as a function from a set of alternatives in some chain (i.e. linearly ordered set). Decision making under many quality criteria is considered. We assume that some rule for preferences is fixed and it leads to a partial ordering on the set of alternatives. We study a problem of construction of generalized criterion for models of decision making under many quality criteria. The main result is connected with finding, of additional information under which a general criterion is unique up to a natural equivalence.

Book Editors: Skarpa, P; Ryant, P; Cerkal, R; Polak, O; Kovarnik, J; Vyskocil, I
Author Full Names: Ryskova, T.; Truhlarova, E.; Klimesova, J.; Smutna, P.
Article Title: THE USE OF PHYSIOLOGICAL AND MORPHOLOGICAL PARAMETERS FOR EVALUATION OF DROUGHT STRESS RESPONSE OF WINTER WHEAT DURING PLANT WILTING
Conference Title: MendelNet International Ph.D. Students Conference
Author Keywords: drought tolerance; RWC; osmotic pressure; roots; wheat
Abstract: Some physiological and morphological parameters were evaluated in four winter wheat varieties during gradual drying. These parameters can influence the level of sensitivity of plants to drought. Intact plants at the stage of the fourth true leaf were explosed to gradual drying and their stress response was evaluated using the measures Relative Water Content and Osmotic Pressure. The size and structure of the root system was simultaneously evaluated as the Specific Root Length parameter. The variety Meritto showed notable differences in all examined parameters. Its plants exhibited delayed onset of wilting, probably due to bigger Specific Root Length and high vigour of plant.

Article Title: Students and Entrepreneurship: Effect of the Training
Source Title: INNOVATION AND SUSTAINABLE COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE: FROM REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO WORLD ECONOMIES, VOLS 1-5
Conference Title: 18th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Author Keywords: entrepreneurial intention; entrepreneurship education; entrepreneurship
Abstract: This paper is intended to explain the formation of entrepreneurial intentions of students of the Faculty of Sfax (Tunisia), after participation in programs or courses in entrepreneurship. We are interested in understanding programs or courses in entrepreneurship in relation to a number of personal and contextual variables. On a theoretical level, it is based on psychosocial models such as the intent theory of planned behavior, based on the studies of Ajzen (1991), and the model of the entrepreneurial event of Shapero Entrepreneurship (Shapero & Sokol, 1982). According to these models, just considering starting a business brings about strong positive feelings, without thought for the reality of this as a desirable and feasible action. Model validation is based on a quantitative study, conducted on 120 students in third grade LMD, following the path of entrepreneurship. The choice of this sample is due to the fact that these students are just a few months away from entering the world of work. Our analysis shows that perceived desirability and feasibility are two prerequisites for the formation of entrepreneurial intentions. Indeed, the existence of an idea or project, and information retrieval, are the factors that contribute most outcomes of predictions on entrepreneurial intention. Our research will build an instrument that facilitates the analysis of the profiles for the recruitment of students wishing to take the entrepreneurial path.

Article Title: THE ENHANCEMENT OF GOVERNMENT-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP MECHANISM IN THE REPUBLIC OF KAZAKHSTAN
Source Title: VITH RYSKULOV READINGS: SOCIO-ECONOMIC MODERNIZATION OF KAZAKHSTAN UNDER CONDITIONS OF GLOBAL FINANCIAL INSTABILITY
Conference Title: International Scientific Forum of the 6th Ryskulov's Readings - Socio-Economic Modernization of Kazakhstan Under Conditions of Global Financial Instability
Author Keywords: government-private partnership; collaboration; government; business; partnership mechanisms; concession; projects
Abstract: Purpose - disclosure of theoretical and methodological aspects of government-private partnership formation, mechanisms of interaction between government and business; designing of recommendations on enhancement of mechanism of government-private partnership in the Republic of Kazakhstan. Methodology - systemic approach, comparative analysis and synthesis. Originality/value - obtained results can be used in designing regulatory documents for solving problems of government-private partnership, further enhancement of mechanism of government and business collaboration; by state authority and management bodies of all levels in practice for optimization of government-private partnership mechanism. Findings - government-private partnership mechanism is revealed through institutional transformations in modern kazakhstanian economy. In present article the author offers to use the government-private partnership model which means reaching consensus between governmental, commercial and public interests as a mechanism of overcoming the crisis consequences.

Book Editors: Skarpa, P; Ryant, P; Cerkal, R; Polak, O; Kovarnik, J; Vyskocil, I
Author Full Names: Stepankova, K.; Novotny, K.; Kaiser, J.; Prochazkova, K.; Kanicky, V; Mancini, L.
Article Title: X-RAY MICROTOMOGRAPHY AS A TECHNIQUE FOR MINERALOGICAL ANALYSIS OF URINARY CALCULI
Conference Title: MendelNet International Ph.D. Students Conference
Author Keywords: Synchrotron radiation; X-Ray microtomography; urinary calculi
Abstract: The aim of this study is to present synchrotron radiation X-ray microtomography (SR-mu CT) as the technique for investigation of the mineralogical composition of urinary calculi fragments in the non-destructive manner at very high resolution. SR-mu CT is proved to be an effective technique for determination of texture, 3D microstructure and composition of kidney stones. Since this technique is non-destructive, traditional analytical methods can also be performed. The comparison of the results obtained by SR-mu CT analysis with those derived from current standard analytical approaches are in a good agreement. As the comparative method was used laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry.

Article Title: Evaluation of economic and social impacts of the sloping land conversion program: A case study in Dunhua County, China
Author Keywords: Conservation set-aside program; Household socio-economic impact; Program sustainability; China
Abstract: Based on data from a household survey the objective of the study was to evaluate the economic and social impacts of the Sloping Land Conversion Program (SLCP). The results indicate that the program was, in general, inefficient because productivity and environmental heterogeneity were given scant consideration in Northeast China. While the program has made a clear attempt to retire plots that are susceptible to soil erosion, there is room for better targeting. Fifty eight per cent of the families involved in afforestation considered themselves worse off after participating in SLCP. The families who experienced a decrease in income were more likely to claim that SLCP was an action forcibly imposed by the government. Although 60% supported the project, a fair proportion (16%) plan to return to cultivating forested areas and grassland once the subsidies of the project end in 2018. The government should widen alternative non-farm employment opportunities in order to ensure the sustainability of the program. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Analysis on Contemporary Chinese Government Function Transformation under the Orientation of Social Fairness and Justice
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: fairness and justice; government function; restraint administration; service administration
Abstract: China is now in the period of social transformation. The conflicts of interest under the pattern of multiple interests appear to be in a tendency of breaking out frequently and seriously. Only by preserving and promoting social fairness and justice can social stability and harmony be realized. Chinese government should regard preserving and promoting social fairness and justice as its value target and make government function transformation according to this value target now. In the aspect of function center, emphasizing efficiency should be changed into promoting justice; in the aspect of function pattern, restraint administration should be changed into service administration; in the aspect of the mode of performing function, the construction of rule of law should be strengthened.

Article Title: The Distortion Logic of Nonproductive Fiscal Subsidy Implementation-Viewing the Home Appliances Subsidy for Rural Areas
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: nonproductive fiscal subsidy; policy implement; distortion mechanism; home appliances subsidy for rural areas
Abstract: Along with our country economy development structure adjustment need, the government gradually began to adopt the nonproductive financial subsidies to promote domestic residents consumption ascension. However, policy distortion happened in the implement process. In order to thrash out such problems, this paper attempts to take home appliance policy for example, discussing the implement distortion of nonproductive fiscal subsidies. Through the policy implement analysis, it is known that the strategy space exists in the implement mechanism induced the local government and merchants turn to pursue their own interests, leading the policy implementation deviates from its original target. To solve the inefficiency of resources allocation like this kind of policy, we must reorganize the strategy space, and perfect the policy implements' supervise mechanism.

Article Title: EVALUATION OF LABOR RESOURCES UTILIZATION EFFICIENCY IN THE REPUBLIC OF KAZAKHSTAN
Source Title: VITH RYSKULOV READINGS: SOCIO-ECONOMIC MODERNIZATION OF KAZAKHSTAN UNDER CONDITIONS OF GLOBAL FINANCIAL INSTABILITY
Conference Title: International Scientific Forum of the 6th Ryskulov's Readings - Socio-Economic Modernization of Kazakhstan Under Conditions of Global Financial Instability
Author Keywords: measures of labor resources utilization; labor efficiency; personnel productivity; personnel profitability; labor cost
Abstract: Purpose - is the improvement of economic aspects of enterprise personnel management and methods of labor utilization evaluation. Methodology - methodological basis for research were research works of domestic and foreign experts in the field of labor economics and management, Efficiency 2020 Program, Methods of labor efficiency estimation for monitoring of State Industrial and Innovation Development Program of the Republic of Kazakhstan for 2010-2014, Methods of labor efficiency, statistical collections and bulletins of the RoK Agency of Statistics and statistical forms of the RoK all-state statistical observations. Originality/value - the results of the work can be used in Kazakhstani enterprises for evaluation of labor resources utilization efficiency in the frame of complex approach in their management; for preparation of diploma, masters' and other works of research nature; for instructing of disciplines Enterprise economics, Labor economics, Personnel management. Findings - the measuring system for evaluation of the labor resources efficiency of the economic players of the Republic of Kazakhstan is proposed and methodically grounded on the basis of using both traditional measures and the new ones, which had been inapplicable in practice before; the necessity and the possibility of their practical application is proved.

Abstract: Sales staffs play an important role in enterprise, enterprises establish the fair and effective incentive mechanism to promote the sales staff to work hard, to create value, to achieve the economic goal of the firm. There are many papers about the salary incentive pattern for sales staff, but the salary incentive mechanism is relatively less. Article Title: Review on the Theoretic Evolution about Original Forces of Technological Progress
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: technological progress; original forces; review
Abstract: This electronic document firstly excavates the thoughts about original forces of technological progress of three classic economists; they are Smith, Marx and Schumpeter. And then this paper points out the defect of the neo-classical economics on original forces study, on the basis of this, science-pushed theory, demand-pulled theory and national innovation system theory are introduced and reviewed, finally this paper concludes that evolutionary research of original forces of technological progress will be the developing trend of technological theory.

Article Title: Reform and Innovation of the Training on Foreign Business Talents in Higher Education Institutes
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF CHINA PRIVATE ECONOMY INNOVATION INTERNATIONAL FORUM 2012
Conference Title: China Private Economy Innovation International Forum
Conference Sponsor: Yangtze River Delta Private Econ Res Assoc, Taizhou Branch,Journal Econ & Social Syst Comparison,Taizhou Merchant Assoc,Taizhou Univ,Ningbo Univ, Sch Business
Author Keywords: innovation; talent training; foreign business talents; private enterprise
Abstract: With the development of economy and society, especially the booming development of private economy in Yangtze Delta Area new requirements have been proposed for colleges and universities to cultivate international business talents. The training of compound foreign business talents in colleges and universities must meet the requirements of the market and the objective needs of China's economic and social development, especially the local private enterprises. This paper conducts a comprehensive study and exploration on the reform and innovation of the training of foreign business talents in higher education institutes from the prospect of the teaching aims, contents, and approaches, and attaches importance on some key elements such as practical teaching, enhancing the construction of teaching faculty, perfecting the management and assessment of teaching quality.

Article Title: Firms' Adaptation of Social Media Promotions
Source Title: INNOVATION AND SUSTAINABLE COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE: FROM REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO WORLD ECONOMIES, VOLS 1-5
Conference Title: 18th International-Business-Information-Management-Association Conference
Author Keywords: Technology acceptance model; Web 2.0; Social Media; Social Media Promotions
Abstract: After the emergence of the Internet there was a noticeable shift in how people and businesses are using the web. A dramatic shift happened when the Web 1.0 gave way to Web 2.0 which changed the way the businesses communicate with customers and introduced us with the concepts such as social media and social media promotions. The applications of social media have been growing rapidly making it the major driving force of this new technology especially from the perspective of businesses. In our study we aimed at revealing the most crucial characteristics of Web 2.0 and Social Media that lead the businesses towards the decision of applying social media promotion activities. We used the Technology Acceptance Model to analyze the companies' ability to govern social media activities in terms of human resources and budget availability, the importance of user generated content to the company and the companies' target group's use of social media channels. The results show that the companies' budget availability to govern social media activities and the target group's use of social media channels along with the perceived usefulness are significant factors towards the companies' attitude to using social media promotions.

Article Title: On Difficulties and Countermeasures of Chinese Commercial Banks' Implementing of New Accounting Standard
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: Commercial Banks; New Accounting Standards; Financial Instruments; Fair Value
Abstract: As requested by CBRC (China Banking Regulatory Commission), the commercial banks in China have implemented new the accounting standards successively. However, compared with the original Financial Enterprise Accounting System, the new accounting standards have changed a lot with respect to accounting methods, risk management, disclosure of information and construction of information system, hence the commercial banks are faced with many problems and difficulties when implementing the new accounting standards. For this reason, with the hope to help commercial banks to implement the new accounting standards, this paper is aimed to give targeted countermeasure and advice through the discussion of these problems and difficulties,.

Article Title: The Emergency Management Practice of Multi-Levels and Multi-Subjects-Case Study of DONGFANG TURBINE Co., LTD
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: Emergency management; Subject; Case study; Dongfang Turbine Co.; LTD
Abstract: The feature of emergent events has made it a difficult and professional work to people. To cope with the emergency, it needs more than just one subject. This article takes the DONGFANG TURBINE Co., LTD as example, and builds a multi-levels, multi-subjects framework for emergency management. We also propose some suggestions from the case.

Article Title: A Combination Distribution Model Based on Extreme Value Statistics and Its Application
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2012 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT INNOVATION AND PUBLIC POLICY (ICMIPP 2012), VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Conference on Management Innovation and Public Policy (ICMIPP)
Author Keywords: tail distribution; combination distribution; weighted optimal model; parameters estimate
Abstract: Based on the theory of extreme value distribution, a combination distribution model that is composed of tail distribution and original distribution for risk analysis is put forward. The method of determining the type of the tail distribution is given. The weighted optimal models of parameters estimation are established. Calculation of the example in engineering shows the combination distribution model can reflect the practice risk.

Article Title: Learning from practices - implications of the practice based approach for forest and environmental policy research
Author Keywords: Epistemology; Ontology; Constructivism; Interpretivism; Objectivism; Positivism; Analytical policy analysis
Abstract: With the book publication Forest and Nature Governance - A practice based approach (Arts et al., 2013, Eds.) the Forest and Nature Conservation Policy Group of Wageningen University, The Netherlands demonstrates its high aspirations of developing a new research approach. This article aims at discussing the methodological and conceptual contributions of the book to the field of forest and environmental policy research and proposes perspectives for further developing this methodological approach. It finds the practice based approach being an innovative, theoretically sound concept, which is able to produce valuable and thick empirical results. The approach is also found offering a plethora of possibilities to link up to analytical policy research. Yet, the approach will require further elaboration, especially on questions regarding the role of definitions, its contribution towards explaining social phenomena, and concerning the use of normative orientations in some of the empirical cases. The future challenges of the approach lie in either moulding a niche for further developing it independent from other schools, or in influencing mainstream approaches through theoretical innovations or surprising empirical results. Authors: Lundborg, P; Nystedt, P; Rooth, DO
Author Full Names: Lundborg, Petter; Nystedt, Paul; Rooth, Dan-Olof
Article Title: Height and Earnings: The Role of Cognitive and Noncognitive Skills
Keywords Plus: LABOR-MARKET OUTCOMES; GRIP STRENGTH; BIRTH-WEIGHT; STATURE; DISCRIMINATION; HERITABILITY; RETURNS; SWEDEN; HEALTH; INCOME
Abstract: We use large-scale register data on 450,000 Swedish males who underwent mandatory military enlistment at age 18, and a subsample of 150,000 siblings, to examine why tall people earn more. We show the importance of both cognitive and noncognitive skills, as well as family background and muscular strength for the height-earnings relationship. In addition, we show that a substantial height premium remains after these factors have been accounted for, which originates from very short people having low earnings. This is mostly explained by the sorting of short people into low-paid occupations, which may indicate discrimination by stature.

Article Title: Anticipation: What about turning the human and social sciences upside down?
Author Keywords: Anticipation; Human and social sciences; Futures studies
Abstract: Human and social scientists are asking themselves whether they should turn their sciences upside down and reshape them from primarily past-oriented sciences to primarily future-oriented ones. This essay presents the recent contributions Seligman et al. (2013), Beckert (2013b), Appadurai (2013) and (Wright, 2010). (C) 2014 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Andersson, C; Törnberg, A; Törnberg, P
Author Full Names: Andersson, Claes; Tornberg, Anton; Tornberg, Petter
Article Title: Societal systems - Complex or worse?
Author Keywords: Complexity; Complicatedness; Wicked problems; Wicked systems; Models; Theory
Abstract: The basic observation that we explore in this paper is simple but, we argue, rich in consequences: societal systems combine two qualities that are commonly referred to as complexity and complicatedness. We address the problem that societal systems remain recalcitrant despite the development of powerful approaches for dealing with both of these qualities. The root of this problem we identify to be that the combination between complexity and complicatedness is emergent; i.e. fundamentally and irreducibly different from either quality in isolation. This means that neither class of such approaches can be expected to work well on their own. But it also means that the obvious strategy of combining theory for complexity and complicatedness may be much more challenging than envisioned. In short, systems where complexity and complicatedness is mixed ought to be treated as a distinct class of systems. Noting a connection to what has long been called wicked problems we hereby outline such a class of systems that we call wicked systems. We introduce a simple model and heuristic and discuss some implications for theorizing and modeling. (C) 2014 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Hamza, K; Rich, KM; Wheat, ID
Author Full Names: Hamza, Kanar; Rich, Karl M.; Wheat, I. David
Article Title: A SYSTEM DYNAMICS APPROACH TO SEA LICE CONTROL IN NORWAY
Author Keywords: sea lice; aquatic diseases; cost-effectiveness; system dynamics; lice control strategies
Abstract: Various methodologies have been used to model the epidemiology and economics of aquatic diseases, including input-output models, benefit-cost analysis, linear programming, compartment models based on differential equations, and spatial models. Despite the virtues of each of these models, there is a need to develop a more integrated approach to the epidemiology and economics of disease that better represents and captures existing feedback mechanisms that can influence the success of disease control interventions and their cost-effectiveness. In this paper, we motivate the use of system dynamics (SD) modeling in the context of sea lice control in Norwegian farmed salmon. Separate models of sea lice and salmon growth were designed and integrated to capture the feedbacks between them. Different simulation scenarios highlight the benefits of the approach. Model results indicated that changing the timing and type of treatment vis-a-vis current practices can markedly reduce sea lice infection pressures; such simulated practices are also more cost effective. Our approach further highlights how delays and feedbacks present in these systems influence the success of any disease control protocol, and demonstrates the utility that SD models can play in aquatic health.

Article Title: Coalitional realignment and the adoption of non-contributory social insurance programmes in Latin America
Author Keywords: social policy; economic reform; employment; public pensions; Latin America
Abstract: What explains the recent rise in non-contributory social insurance programmes in Latin America? Since the 1990s, Latin American countries have enacted significant social policy reforms that have supplemented contributory insurance policies with new or expanded non-contributory programmes, financed by general tax revenues. We present a political explanation for this phenomenon, arguing that the process of deindustrialization, and especially the increased labour insecurity that it entails, has changed the mix of social insurance policies favoured by different individuals in the income and employment distributions. A long-term increase in economic insecurity has increased the relative demand for tax-financed, rather than contribution-financed, social insurance. Elected officials, especially those in the recent 'rise of the Left' in Latin America, have proved eager to meet these demands. We find strong evidence for this argument using both cross-national data on non-contributory pension policy adoption and individual-level data on policy preferences.

Authors: Garcia-Duran, P; Kienzle, B; Millet, M
Author Full Names: Garcia-Duran, Patricia; Kienzle, Benjamin; Millet, Montserrat
Article Title: Revisiting European Influence: The Case of Agricultural Trade Negotiations
Keywords Plus: FOREIGN-POLICY; ONE VOICE; EU; POWER; UNION; DELEGATION; BRAZIL; GLOBALIZATION; SOVEREIGNTY; CHALLENGE
Abstract: In recent years, scholars have called into question the often-heard policy statements that link a stronger single voice of the European Union (EU) to more European influence in international negotiations. This article examines this challenge in an area where the EU has a particularly long tradition of establishing common policies: agriculture. By comparing in particular the international agricultural negotiations that have taken place in the framework of the Uruguay and the Doha Development Rounds (up until Cancun), it argues that internal coherence is actually not a sufficient condition for EU influence in these negotiations. On the contrary, by building on different strands of literature - International Relations, EU studies and trade policy - it shows that the EU's ability to influence outcomes has been increasingly affected by external developments. More specifically, the article draws on three crucial external processes in this regard: First, emerging powers have gained substantial commercial weight. Second, key countries, especially Brazil, have played an increasingly active role in the negotiations. Third, these countries have strengthened their positions through successful coalition-building. Consequently, if European policy-makers want to increase the EU's influence in agricultural trade negotiations, they have to more consciously adapt its negotiation approaches to the changing external negotiation environment.

Article Title: The effects of early tracking on student performance: Evidence from a school reform in Bavaria
Author Keywords: Tracking; Student performance; PISA
Keywords Plus: ACADEMIC-ACHIEVEMENT; SECONDARY-SCHOOLS; COGNITIVE SKILLS; HIGHER-EDUCATION; ABILITY; OPPORTUNITY; TRANSITION; COUNTRIES; EQUALITY; RESOURCE
Abstract: This paper evaluates a school reform in Bavaria that moved the timing of tracking in low- and middle-track schools from grade 6 to grade 4; students in high-track schools were not affected. To eliminate state-specific and school-type-specific shocks, I estimate a triple-differences model using three PISA waves. The results indicate that the reform reduced the performance of 15-year-old students both in low- and middle-track schools. Further evidence suggests that the share of very low-performing students increased in low-track schools. (C) 2014 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Why Do Stock Prices Drop by Less Than the Amount of the Dividend? Evidence from a Unique Environment
Author Keywords: dividends; limit order; market microstructure; tax effects
Keywords Plus: BEHAVIOR; RETURNS; MARKET; DISCRETENESS; REDUCTION; TAXES
Abstract: This paper investigates the effect of a lack of an automated limit order adjustment mechanism on ex-dividend day stock price behavior in a unique environment in which there are no taxes on dividends and capital gains. It finds that the overnight drop in the ask price is smaller than the overnight drop in the bid price. In addition, the study finds that average price drops are smaller than the dividend amount for all dividend sizes. I also find no evidence of a sawtooth-shaped relationship between the dividend amount and the ex-day price drop. These results are generally consistent with the lack of an automated limit order adjustment mechanism.

Article Title: SO SLOW TO CHANGE: THE LIMITED GROWTH OF NONTAX REVENUES IN PUBLIC EDUCATION FINANCE, 1991-2010
Abstract: We examine changes in the use of nontax revenues for education finance from 1991 to 2010. Beyond the summary of usage over time, we ask whether nontraditional revenues like fees accentuate or mitigate the impact of downturns. More generally, we examine the extent to which school districts have responded to fiscal pressures by turning to nontax revenues. We also document the extent to which the use of nontax revenues varies across districts according to student poverty status. We show that alternative revenues continue to be a small source of local revenues and have increased quite little since the early 1990s. There was at most a minimal shift to nontax revenues in downturns, though there is evidence of greater use of these revenues among school districts facing more permanent fiscal pressures like tax limits. Differential access to fee revenues and other alternative revenues during downturns may slightly accentuate inequities in K-12 education spending.
